conclusion: Understanding the flow of liquid through baffles to predict which container it will flow into.
Baffles are labeled A, B, C, and D, and liquid flows from the top through these baffles.
Liquid from Baffle A will be redirected by the baffle.
Liquid from Baffle B will be redirected by the baffle.
Liquid from Baffle C will be redirected by the baffle.
Liquid from Baffle D will be redirected by the baffle.
Liquid will follow paths determined by baffles towards either container E or F.
Liquid from A and D will be directed towards container F, and liquid from B and C will be directed towards container E.
Final answer: Liquid from A and D will flow into container F; liquid from B and C will flow into container E.
